questions.question: Contraction of circular and longitudinal muscles in the small intestine results in:

choices.answer: Absorption of food into the capillaries
Movement of food through the gut
Mixing food with enzymes
Creating digestive enzymes

questions.question: The role of the pancreas in digestion is to:

choices.answer: Secrete pancreatic amylase into the small intestine
Physically breakdown food through peristalsis
Allow food to pass through it during digestion
Secrete panreatic pepsin into the small intestine

questions.question: Pepsin in the stomach plays what role in digestion?

choices.answer: Breaks down lipids into fatty acids
Breaks down lipids into amino acids
Breaks down proteins into fatty acids
Breaks down proteins into amino acids

questions.question: Which of the following is true regarding pancreatic lipase?

choices.answer: It breaks down lipids to fatty acids in the small intestine
It breaks down lipids to amino acids in the small intestine
It breaks down lipids to amino acids in the pancreas
It breaks down lipids to fatty acids in the pancreas

questions.question: Which of the following is true regarding villi and microvilli In the small intestine?

choices.answer: They increase the surface area for assimilation
They decrease the surface area for assimilation
They increase the surface area for absorption
They decrease the surface area for absorption

questions.question: Which of the following are NOT absorbed by the villi?

choices.answer: Fatty acids
Proteins
Mineral ions
Vitamins

questions.question: In the villi, which of the following is true?

choices.answer: Glucose and amino acids are absorbed into the lacteal
Glucose and amino acids are absorbed into the capillaries
Fatty acids are absorbed into the lacteal
Fatty acids are absorbed into the capillaries

questions.question: Different methods of transport are used to absorb different nutrients.  Which is true:

choices.answer: Water is absorbed by active transport
Fatty acids are co-transported with Na+ by active transport
Glucose is co-transported with Na+ by active transport
Lipids are absorbed by active transport

questions.question: Which of the following correctly describes starch digestion in the small intestine?

choices.answer: Pancreatic amylase breaks down starch into maltose
Pancreatic amylase breaks down starch into glucose
Pancreatic maltase breaks down starch into maltose
Pancreatic maltase breaks down starch into glucose

questions.question: Which of the following correctly identifies the tissue layers of the small intestine?

choices.answer: A - submucosa; B- circular muscle; C - longitudinal muscle
A - submucosa; B- longitudinal muscle; C - circular muscle
B - circular muscle; C - longitudinal muscle; D - Submucosa
B - longitudinal muscle; C - circular muscle; D - submucosa

questions.question: Identify the following parts of the digestive system:

choices.answer: A - Trachea; B - Stomach; C - Pancreas
A - Esophagus; B - Stomach; C - Liver
A - Trachea; B - Stomach; C - Liver
A - Esophagus; B - Stomach; C - Pancreas
